The sketch consists of two faces: face_1 and face_2. We will focus on face_1. Face_1 has two loops: loop_1 and loop_2. Loop_1 is a rectangular loop and loop_2 is a circular loop. Loop_1 consists of 4 curves in the following sequence: - arc_1: A clockwise arc with a start point at [0.0, 0.1233], a mid point at [0.1233, 0.0], and an end point at [0.2466, 0.1233]. - line_1: A line with a start point at [0.2466, 0.1233] and an end point at [0.2466, 0.6161]. - line_2: A line with a start point at [0.2466, 0.6161] and an end point at [0.0, 0.75]. - line_3: A line with a start point at [0.0, 0.75] and an end point at [0.0, 0.1233]. Loop_2 is a circular loop with a center at [0.1233, 0.1233] and a radius of 0.0925. After creating the sketch, scale it by a factor of 0.75. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D by rotating it -90 degrees around the Z-axis and translating it by [0.0, 0.0411, 0.0]. Extrude the 3D model to a depth of 0.0411 towards the normal and 0 towards the opposite direction of the normal. The final dimensions of the part are as follows: - Length: 0.75 - Width: 0.0411 - Height: 0.75</description>
